## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm trying to understand the `setidentitytrust` command in Verus. Can you explain its purpose and how to use it to manage identity trust lists in my wallet?

**AI Assistant:**
The `setidentitytrust` command in Verus is used to manage identity trust lists in your wallet. This command allows you to clear all existing trust lists, set or remove ratings for specific IDs, and configure the identity trust mode.

Here's a breakdown of the arguments you can pass to the `setidentitytrust` command:

* `clearall`: A boolean value that, when set to `true`, clears all existing wallet identity trust lists before performing any other operations.
* `setratings`: An object that specifies the IDs and their corresponding ratings. You can use this to replace existing ratings for specific IDs.
* `removeratings`: An array of IDs for which you want to erase ratings.
* `identitytrustmode`: A number that determines the trust mode for your wallet. The possible values are:
	+ 0: No restrictions on synchronization.
	+ 1: Only synchronize with IDs that have been rated as approved.
	+ 2: Synchronize with all IDs except those on the block list.

To use the `setidentitytrust` command, you can either use the Verus command-line interface or make an RPC call using `curl`. Here are some examples:

* Using the Verus command-line interface: `verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'`
* Using `curl`: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`

Note that the `setidentitytrust` command does not return any value on success, but will return an error if something goes wrong.

What is the purpose of the `setidentitytrust` command in Verus, and how do you use it to manage identity trust lists in your wallet?

The `setidentitytrust` command in Verus is used to manage identity trust lists in your wallet. This command allows you to clear all existing trust lists, set or remove ratings for specific IDs, and configure the identity trust mode.

Here's a breakdown of the arguments you can pass to the `setidentitytrust` command:

* `clearall`: A boolean value that, when set to `true`, clears all existing wallet identity trust lists before performing any other operations.
* `setratings`: An object that specifies the IDs and their corresponding ratings. You can use this to replace existing ratings for specific IDs.
* `removeratings`: An array of IDs for which you want to erase ratings.
* `identitytrustmode`: A number that determines the trust mode for your wallet. The possible values are:
	+ 0: No restrictions on synchronization.
	+ 1: Only synchronize with IDs that have been rated as approved.
	+ 2: Synchronize with all IDs except those on the block list.

To use the `setidentitytrust` command, you can either use the Verus command-line interface or make an RPC call using `curl`. Here are some examples:

* Using the Verus command-line interface: `verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'`
* Using `curl`: `curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/`

Note that the `setidentitytrust` command does not return any value on success, but will return an error if something goes wrong.

setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'

Arguments
{
  "clearall": bool               (bool, optional) clears all wallet identity trust lists before adding, removing, or trust mode operations
  "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}  (obj, optional) replaces ratings for specified IDs with those given
  "removeratings":["id",...]         (strarray, optional) erases ratings for IDs specified
  "identitytrustmode": <n>           (number, optional) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list
}

Result:
no return on success, else error

Examples:
> verus setidentitytrust '{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytrust", "params": ['{"clearall": bool, "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...}, "removeratings":["id",...], "identitytrustmode":<n>}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
